page.title: 03FARMING IN BURNHAM MARKET 2
page.content:
{ Arable Farming}
Most of the land in this area is Grade 3 and is almost entirely used for arable purposes. Wheat, winter and spring barley, oilseed rape and sugar beet are the main crops. Smaller acreages of hay, fodder beet, sprouts, beans and lupins are grown. One farm has 15 acres left fallow and another 2\ acres. All the farms use mechanical sprayers for their crops. There is a renewed interest in{ {forestry}in the area. Muckleton has recently planted five new plantations of hardwoods and evergreens. Friar's Thorne Farm has this year planted a half acre of spruce, corsican conifer and hardwood (oak, ash and maple). Sussex Farm has a 100 year old planted wood. Gallow Hill Farm has some walnut trees.
